Translation:设计和建筑的科学，或大规模的建筑物，美学和功能标准一致。

Code: 541
English Term:Arctic ecosystem
Chinese Term:北极生态系统


Code: 542
English Term:Arctic Ocean
Definition:The smallest and most poorly studied of the oceans on earth. It covers an area of 14 million square km that is divided by three submarine ridges, i.e. the Alpha Ridge, the Lomonosov Ridge, and an extension of the mid-Atlantic ridge. It is also nearly landlocked, covered year-round by pack ice, and the third of its area is continental shelf.&#10;(Source: OCEAN)
Chinese Term:北冰洋
Translation: 地球上最小且被研究最少的大洋。 它覆盖着一千四百万平方公里的区域，被三条水下脊分开，即阿尔法脊、罗蒙诺索夫脊、和一条延伸到到中大西洋的脊。 它几乎完全被陆地包围，终年为浮冰所覆盖，它的三分之一是大陆棚。

Code: 543
English Term:Arctic region
Definition:The northernmost area of the earth, centered on the North Pole, that includes the Arctic Ocean, the northern reaches of Canada, Alaska, Russia, Norway and most of Greenland, Iceland and Svalbard.&#10;(Source: INP)
Chinese Term:北极地区
Translation: 地球的极北方，以北极为中心，包括北冰洋、加拿大的北方地带、阿拉斯加、俄罗斯、挪威以及格陵兰岛的大部分、冰岛与斯瓦尔巴岛。 

Code: 547
English Term:area of potential pollution
Definition:Area which is supposedly causing dangers to human health and environment.&#10;(Source: ECHO2)
Chinese Term:潜在污染地区
Translation:对人类健康和环境有潜在危险的地区。
Code: 14975
English Term:area under stress
Definition:Areas that are flooded by rising number of tourists or other kinds of pressure and suffer from insufficient or inappropriate planning and management. Damage frequently arises from a lack of understanding or interest of the value of such sites.&#10;(Source: WPR)
Chinese Term:受压地区
Translation: 被日益增多的游客数量或其他压力所挤满，且承受着不足或不当计划和管理的区域。 由于对这些地区的价值缺乏兴趣和理解，损害因而常常发生。

Code: 552
English Term:arid land
Definition:Lands characterized by low annual rainfall of less than 250 mm, by evaporation exceeding precipitation and a sparse vegetation.&#10;(Source: LBC)
Chinese Term:干旱地区
Translation:年降雨量小于250mm，蒸发量超过降水量，植物稀少的地区。

Code: 551
English Term:arid land ecosystem
Definition:The interacting system of a biological community and its non-living environmental surroundings in a climatic region where the annual precipitation averages less than 10 inches per year.&#10;(Source: TOE / DOE)
Chinese Term:干旱区生态系统
Translation: 在年平均降雨量少于10英寸的气候区，生态群落的交互影响的系统及生态群落的非生命周围环境。


Code: 556
English Term:armament
Definition:The weapons, ammunition and equipment, or the total force held by a military unit or state.&#10;(Source: RHW)
Chinese Term:武装
Translation:武器，弹药和装备，或者军队或国家的全部武装力量。
Code: 557
English Term:armament conversion
Definition:Change in character, form or function of the arms and equipment with which a military unit is supplied.
Chinese Term:军事改造
Translation: 对军事单位所提供的武器或装备在特性、形式或功能上进行改变。

Code: 558
English Term:armed forces
Definition:The military units of a state, typically divided by their differing contexts of operations, such as the army, navy, air force and marines.&#10;(Source: RHW)
Chinese Term:武装力量
Translation:国家的武装单位，一般根据各单位不同的作战内容分类，比如陆军，海军，空军以及海军陆战队。
Code: 560
English Term:aromatic compound
Definition:Compounds characterized by the presence of at least one benzene ring.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:芳香族化合物
Translation:至少含有一个苯环的化合物
Code: 562
English Term:aromatic hydrocarbon
Definition:Hydrocarbons having an unsaturated ring containing alternating double and single bonds, especially containing a benzene ring.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term:芳香族碳氢化合物
Translation:包含有双键和单键的不饱和环，并且有苯环的碳氢化合物。
Code: 564
English Term:aromatic substance
Definition:Substance having a distinctive, usually fragrant smell.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term:芳香物
Translation:有独特味道，一般是香味的物质。
Code:566
English Term:arrangement for a deposit on packaging
Definition:Agreement to provide refunds or payments in exchange for used bottles or packaging materials.&#10;(Source: RHW)
Chinese Term:包装定金的安排
Translation:对使用过的瓶子或包装材料有偿回收的协议。
Code:567
English Term:arsenic
Definition:A toxic metalloid element, existing in several allotropic forms, that occurs principally in realgar and orpiment and as the free element. It is used in transistors, lead-based alloys, and high temperature brasses.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term:砷
Translation:一种有毒的非金属元素，以几种同素异形体的形式存在，主要为二硫化二砷和雌黄以及其他自由元素。被用于晶体管，含铅合金，以及高温黄铜制品。
Code:568
English Term:art
Definition:The creation of works of beauty or other special significance.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term:艺术
Translation:美和其他具有特别意义的物体的创作。
Code:571
English Term:arthropod
Definition:The largest phylum in the animal kingdom; adults typically have segmented body, a sclerotized integument, and many-jointed segmental limbs.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:节肢动物
Translation:动物界最大的门，成年个体有节状肢体，硬化外皮，以及多个有接缝的节状肢体。
Code:572
English Term:Articulata
Definition:Animals characterized by the repetition of similar segments (metameres), exhibited especially by arthropods, annelids, and vertebrates in early embryonic stages and in certain specialized adult structures.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 
Translation: 相似组成部分重复出现的动物，主要包括节肢动物，环节动物，以及胚胎期的脊椎动物和某些专门的成年结构。



Code:579
English Term:artificial lake
Definition:Lakes created behind manmade barriers.&#10;(Source: PARCOR)
Chinese Term:人工湖
Translation:人工建造的湖。
Code:13320
English Term:artificial reproductive technique
Chinese Term:人工再生技术
Code:587
English Term:artificial satellite
Definition:Any man-made object placed in a near-periodic orbit in which it moves mainly under the gravitational influence of one celestial body, such as the earth, sun, another planet, or a planet’s moon.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:人造卫星
Translation:任何放置在接近周期性轨道的人工物体，主要依靠某个天体的重力进行运动，比如地球，太阳，其他星球，以及某个星球的卫星。
Code:591
English Term:asbestos
Definition:Generic name for a group of fibrous mineral silicates. It includes blue asbestos (crocidolite), white asbestos (chrysotile) and brown asbestos (amosite). After they are mined the asbestos fibres are separated from the rock and are spun into a cloth. When inhaled the fibres penetrate the lungs and the tissues of the bronchial tubes, resulting in asbestosis, a crippling lung disease. Asbestos also causes cancer of the lung and the gastro-intestinal tract, and mesothelioma, a malignant cancer of the inner lining of the chest. However, because it is a poor conductor of electricity and highly resistant to heat it has been widely used over the years in fire-fighting suits, and building and insulating materials. The fibrous form of several silicate minerals, at one time widely used for electrical and thermal insulation; the use of all forms of asbestos is now either banned or strictly controlled in many countries since it causes cancer.&#10;(Source: WRIGHT / ALL)
Chinese Term:石棉
Translation:一类纤维状矿物硅酸盐的总称。包括蓝色石棉（青石棉），白色石棉（温石棉）和棕色石棉（铁石棉）。在挖掘出来后石棉纤维被从岩石中分离，并且被纺进一块布料中。如果被吸入，纤维将会穿过肺和支气管的组织，导致石棉沉滞症，一种会导致失去其功能的肺病。石棉也会引起肺部和胃肠部的癌症，以及间皮瘤，一种胸部内的恶性癌症。然而，因为它是一种便宜的导电物质，而且高度绝热，多年来它被广泛应用到防火服装，建筑物和绝缘材料中。包括被广泛应用的绝缘和绝热材料中的许多硅酸盐的纤维形式 ，石棉的各种用途现在已经被很多国家禁止或严格控制，因为它会导致癌症。
Code:594
English Term:asbestos cement
Definition:A hardened mixture of asbestos fibers, Portland cement and water used in relatively thin slabs for shingles, wallboard and siding.&#10;(Source: WEBSTE)
Chinese Term:石棉水泥
Translation:石棉纤维，波特兰（Portland）水泥和水的加固混合物，被用在相对较薄的墙板和侧板中。
Code:11752
English Term:asbestosis
Definition:A non-malignant progressive, irreversible, lung disease, characterized by diffuse fibrosis, resulting from the inhalation of asbestos fibers.&#10;(Source: CONFER)
Chinese Term:石棉沉滞症
Translation:恶性，不能还原的肺部疾病。由石棉纤维的吸入导致，具有扩散纤维化的特征。
Code:595
English Term:ASEAN
Definition:Association of Southeast Asian Nations.&#10;(Source: MIIS)
Chinese Term:东盟（ASEAN）
Translation:东南亚国际联盟
Code:596
English Term:ash
Definition:The incombustible matter remaining after a substance has been incinerated.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:灰烬
Translation:一种物质被焚烧后残余的不可燃物质。

Code:598
English Term:Asia
Definition:The world’s largest continent. It occupies the eastern part of the Eurasian landmass and its adjacent islands and is separated from Europe by the Ural Mountains. Asia borders on the Arctic Ocean, the Pacific Ocean, the Indian Ocean, and the Mediterranean and Red Seas in the west. It includes the largest peninsulas of Asia Minor, India, Arabia, and Indochina and the island groups of Japan, Indonesia, the Philippines, and Ceylon; contains the mountain ranges of the Hindu Kush, Himalayas, Pamirs, Tian Shan, Urals, and Caucasus, the great plateaus of India, Iran and Tibet, vast plains and deserts, and the valleys of many large rivers including the Mekong, Irrawaddy, Indus, Ganges, Tigris and Euphrates.&#10;(Source: AMHER / CED)
Chinese Term:亚洲
Translation:世界上最大的大陆。占据了欧亚大陆的东部，邻近岛屿，以乌拉尔山脉作为和欧洲的分隔线。亚洲接壤北冰洋，太平洋，印度洋以及地中海和西方的红海。包括小亚细亚最大的半岛，印度，阿拉伯半岛，中国，和日本群岛，印度尼西亚，菲律宾，斯里兰卡；包括喜马拉雅山脉边缘，帕米尔高原，天山，乌拉尔山脉和高加索山脉，印度最大的高原，伊朗，广阔的平原和沙漠，很多大河的山谷比如底格里斯河，幼发拉底河。
Code:13077
English Term:assay
Definition:Qualitative or quantitative determination of the components of a material, such as an ore or a drug.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 化验分析
Translation:对于某种物质，比如矿石或者药材，组成部分的定性或者定量的分析。
Code:605
English Term:assimilation
Definition:Conversion of nutritive material to living tissue.&#10;(Source: KOREN)
Chinese Term:同化作用
Translation:营养物质对活体组织的转化。

Code:607
English Term:association
Definition:A body of persons associated for the regulation of a common economic activity by means of a special organization.&#10;(Source: SHOOX / ZINZAN)
Chinese Term:组织
Translation:通过一种特殊的组织方式，一群人联合起来管理一项日常的经济活动。

Code:611
English Term:astronautics
Definition:The science of space flight.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:航天学
Translation:研究太空飞行的科学。

Code:612
English Term:astronomy
Definition:The science concerned with celestial bodies and the observation and interpretation of the radiation received in the vicinity of the earth from the component parts of the universe.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:天文学
Translation:和天体以及对一些射线的观察和解释的科学。这些从地球附近接收到，来自宇宙其他组成部分。

Code:616
English Term:atlas
Definition:A bound collection of maps or charts, plates, engravings or tables illustrating any subject.&#10;(Source: CCL / RHW)
Chinese Term:地图集
Translation:装订好的地图，图标，印版，版画或者表述任意主题的插话的合集。

Code:617
English Term:atmosphere
Definition:The gaseous envelope surrounding the Earth in a several kilometers-thick layer.&#10;(Source: UVAROVa)
Chinese Term: 大气层
Translation: 气态的围绕在地球上空，若干千米厚的一层物质。
Code:12008
English Term:atmospheric aerosol
Definition:Particulate matter suspended in the air. The particulate matter may be in the form of dusts, fumes, or mist. Aerosols in the atmosphere are the form in which pollutants such as smoke are dispersed.&#10;(Source: LANDY / PHC)
Chinese Term:大气悬浮微粒
Translation:空气中悬浮的微粒物质。这些微粒物质可能以灰尘，烟雾或者雾气的形式存在。大气中的悬浮微粒是一些污染物（比如烟雾）的消散方式。
Code:621
English Term:atmospheric chemistry
Definition:The study of the production, transport, modification, and removal of atmospheric constituents in the troposphere and stratosphere.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:大气化学
Translation:研究对流层和平流层中大气组成部分的制造，转移，转变和移除的科学。
Code:622
English Term:atmospheric circulation
Definition:The general movement and circulation of air, which transfers energy between different levels of the atmosphere. The mechanisms of circulation are very complicated. They involve the transfer of energy between the oceans and the atmosphere, the land and the atmosphere, as well as the different levels of the atmosphere.&#10;(Source: WRIGHT)
Chinese Term:大气循环
Translation:大气的普通运动和循环，可以将不同层面的大气能量转移。循环的机制非常复杂，包括海洋和大气层之间能量转移，大气和陆地之间的能量转移，以及不同层面大气层的能量转移。
Code:623
English Term:atmospheric component
Definition:The Earth’s atmosphere consists by volume of nitrogen (79,1%), oxygen (20,9%), carbon dioxide (about 0,03%) and traces of the noble gases (argon, krypton, xenon, helium) plus water vapour, traces of ammonia, organic matter, ozone, various salts and suspended solid particles.&#10;(Source: ALL)
Chinese Term:大气组成成分
Translation:地球的大气由氮气（19.1%），氧气（20.9%），二氧化碳（0.03%）和少许惰性气体（氦，氩，氪，氙）加上水蒸气，少量氨，有机物，臭氧，各种盐和固态悬浮颗粒。
Code:624
English Term:atmospheric composition
Definition:The chemical abundance in the earth’s atmosphere of its constituents including nitrogen, oxygen, argon, carbon dioxide, water vapour, ozone, neon, helium, krypton, methane, hydrogen and nitrous oxide.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:大气组成
Translation:大气成分中的化学成分，包括氮，氧气，二氧化碳，氦，氩，氪，氙，以及水蒸气，甲烷，氢气，臭氧，氮氧化物。
Code:14915
English Term:atmospheric correction
Definition:The removal from the remotely sensed data of the atmospheric effects caused by the scattering and absorption of sunlight by particles; the removal of these effects improves not only the quality of the observed earth surface imaging but also the accuracy of classification of the ground objects.&#10;(Source: YOUNG)
Chinese Term:大气纠正
Translation:对遥远感知到的大气数据中由于大气微粒引起的散射的吸收而带来的印象进行移除。这些移除动作不仅提高了观察到的地球表面图像的质量，也提高了地面物体分类的精确度。
Code:625
English Term:atmospheric emission
Definition:Suspended pollutants—solid particles, liquid aerosols, etc.—or toxic gases released into the atmosphere from a polluting source, or type of source.&#10;(Source: ISEP)
Chinese Term:大气放射
Translation:从一个或者一类污染源中释放到大气中的悬浮的污染物——固体微粒，液态气溶胶等——或者有毒气体。
Code:12026
English Term:atmospheric fallout
Definition:The sedimentation of dust or fine particles from the atmosphere.&#10;(Source: LEE)
Chinese Term:大气沉降物
Translation:大气中尘土或者微粒的沉降。
Code:626
English Term:atmospheric humidity
Definition:A measurable quantity of the moisture content found in the earth’s atmosphere.&#10;(Source: RHW)
Chinese Term:大气湿度
Translation:可测量到数量的大气中的水分。



Code:12082
English Term:atmospheric inversion
Definition:A temperature inversion in the atmosphere in which the temperature, instead of falling, increases with height above the ground. With the colder and heavier air below, there is no tendency to form upward currents and turbulence is suppressed. Inversions are often formed in the late afternoon when the radiation emitted from the ground exceeds that received from the sinking sun. Inversions are also caused by katabatic winds, that is cold winds flowing down the hillside into a valley, and by anticyclones. In inversion layers, both vertical and horizontal diffusion is inhibited and pollutants become trapped, sometimes for long periods. Low-level discharges of pollutants are more readily trapped by inversions than high level dischargers, hence the case for high stacks. Furthermore, high level discharges into an inversion tend to remain at a high level because of the absence of vertical mixing.&#10;(Source: GILP96)
Chinese Term:大气倒置
Translation:大气中的温度倒置，在这种状况中，气温随着海拔的增加不减反增。由于下面更重更冷的空气，没有形成上升气流的趋势，湍流也被压制。倒置通常在下午晚些时候形成，这时候地面发出的射线超过了接收的来自下沉太阳的射线。倒置也会由下降风引起，这种风会以反气旋的形式从山上吹到山谷里。在倒置层，污染物的水平和竖直扩散都会被抑制从而被困住，有时会持续很长时间。低处的污染物放电比高处的更容易被倒置困住。而且，高处的污染物向倒置大气放电仍会保持在高处，因为缺少竖直混合。

Code:627
English Term:atmospheric layering
Definition:Any one of a number of strata or layers of the earth’s atmosphere; temperature distribution is the most common criterion used for denoting the various shell. Also known as atmospheric shell; atmospheric region.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:大气分层
Translation:大气中的任意一层，温度分布是最常见的标准，用来指代不同的层次。也称作大气壳，大气区域。

Code:629
English Term:atmospheric model
Definition:A simulation, pattern or plan designed to demonstrate the structure or workings of the atmosphere surrounding any object, including the Earth.&#10;(Source: APD)
Chinese Term:大气模型
Translation:用来展示大气围绕着物体（包括地球）时的工作方式的模型。

Code:631
English Term:atmospheric monitoring
Definition:A practice of continuous atmospheric sampling by various levels of government or particular industries.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:大气监测
Translation:由各级政府或者某些企业进行持续的大气取样的实施。
Code:632
English Term:atmospheric ozone
Definition:A triatomic molecule of oxygen; a natural constituent of the atmosphere, with the highest concentrations in the ozone layer or stratosphere; it is found at a level between 15 and 30 km above the Earth, which prevents harmful ultraviolet B radiation, which causes skin cancer and threatens plant life, from reaching the ground. The fragile shield is being damaged by chemicals released on Earth. The main chemicals that are depleting stratospheric ozone are chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs), which are used in refrigerators, aerosols and as cleaners in many industries and halons, which are used in fire extinguishers. The damage is caused when these chemicals release highly reactive forms of chlorine and bromine.&#10;(Source: GILP96 / WRIGHT)
Chinese Term:大气臭氧
Translation:三个氧原子构成的分子；大气中的自然组成部分之一，在臭氧层或平流层含量最高；在地表上15km到30km被发现，可以阻止有害的紫外线到达地表，这种紫外线会引发皮肤癌，威胁植物生命。这层脆弱的防护盾正在被地球释放的化学物损坏，其中的主要化学物为含氯氟烃 (CFC)，这种物质在冰箱中，气溶胶中用到。也被当作清洁剂，用在工业生产及灭火器中的碳、溴或卤的气体化合物中。当这些化学物释放高度放射性的氟和氯时，臭氧层便会受到损害。

Code:633
English Term:atmospheric particulate
Definition:A concentration of fine liquid or solid particles, such as dust, smoke, mist, fumes or smog, found in the atmosphere.&#10;(Source: TOE)
Chinese Term:大气微粒
Translation:微小的液态或固态微粒聚合物，比如大气中的灰尘，烟，烟雾，雾气。

Code:634
English Term:atmospheric physics
Definition:The study of the physical phenomena of the atmosphere.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:大气物理
Translation:研究大气中物理现象的科学。

Code:636
English Term:atmospheric pollution
Definition:The presence in the air of one or more contaminants in such a concentration and of such duration as to cause a nuisance or to be injurious to human life, animal life or vegetation.&#10;(Source: LANDY)
Chinese Term:大气污染
Translation:大气中持久性地聚集，会对人类，动植物生命造成伤害的大气中的污染物。


Code:637
English Term:atmospheric precipitation
Definition:The settling out of water from cloud in the form of dew, rain, hail, snow, etc.&#10;(Source: ALL)
Chinese Term:大气降水
Translation:以露珠，雨水，冰雹，雪等形式从云中释放出的水。
Code:639
English Term:atmospheric process
Definition:Atmospheric processes are distinguished in physical and chemical processes and both types may be operating simultaneously in complicated and interdependent ways. The physical processes of transport by atmospheric winds and the formation of clouds and precipitation strongly influence the patterns and rates of acidic deposition, while chemical reactions govern the forms of the compounds deposited.&#10;(Source: PARCOR)
Chinese Term:大气活动
Translation:大气活动分为物理活动和化学活动，两种类型都可能同时以复杂并且各自独立的方式出现。大气中风，云和降雨运输强烈影响酸性物质形成的方式和速率，同时化学反应控制着化合物形成的形式。
Code:640
English Term:atmospheric science
Definition:The atmospheric sciences study the dynamics, physics and chemistry of atmospheric phenomena and processes, including the interactions of the atmosphere with soil physics, hydrology and oceanic circulation. The research focuses on the following areas: turbulence and convection, atmospheric radiation and remote sensing, aerosol and cloud physics and chemistry, planetary atmospheres, air-sea interactions, climate, and statistical meteorology.&#10;(Source: ATS)
Chinese Term:大气科学
Translation:大气科学研究大气现象及过程的动力学，物理学和化学，包括大气和土地物理，水文学和海洋循环的互相作用。研究关注以下领域：湍流，对流，大气辐射和遥感，悬浮微粒，云物理和云化学，行星大气层，空气和海洋的互相影响，气候，统计气象学。
Code:641
English Term:atmospheric structure
Definition:The gaseous area surrounding the planet is divided into several concentric spherical strata (layers, like shells) separated by narrow transition zones. The boundaries are know as “pause”. More than 99% of the total atmospheric mass is concentrated in the first 40 km from the Earth’s surface. Atmospheric layers are characterized by differences in chemical composition that produce variations in temperature.&#10;(Source: KSW)
Chinese Term:大气结构
Translation:围绕星球的气体分为几个同心球状层，这些层由狭窄的过渡区域分开。它们之间的界限称作“中止”。超过99%的气体总量集中在最靠近地表的40km部分。不同的大气层化学组成部分在不同温度下会产生不同的物质。

Code:11713
English Term:atrazine
Definition:Herbicide belonging to the triazine group, widely employed and particularly in maize crops. It is highly toxic for phytoplancton and freshwater algae and, being highly soluble in water, it easily contaminates aquifers.&#10;(Source: RAMADE)
Chinese Term: 阿特拉津（莠去津)
Translation: 属于三嗪类的杀虫剂。被广泛应用在作物中，特别是玉米。对于浮游植物和淡水藻类有剧毒，容易污染含水土层。

Code:14923
English Term:attribute
Definition:A distinctive feature of an object. In mapping and GIS applications, the objects are points, lines, or polygons that represent features such as sampling locations, section corners (points); roads and streams (lines); lakes, forest and soil types (polygons). These attributes can be further divided into classes such as tree species Douglas-fir and ponderosa pine) for forest types and paved and gravel for road types. Multiple attributes are generally associated with objects that are located on a single map layer.&#10;(Source: FORUMT)
Chinese Term:属性
Translation:某个物体的特殊性质。在绘图和ＧＩＳ应用程序中，物体包括点，线，多边形，它们代表一些特性，比如地点，区域角落（点），路线和河流（线）；河，森林和土壤类型（多边形）。这些属性可以被进一步分类，比如按照树木种类分为花旗松和西黄松，按照道路种类分为铺好的路和碎石路。在单一的地图层上，一般会有多种属性。
Code:654
English Term:attribution
Definition:Under certain circumstances, the tax law applies attribution rules to assign to one taxpayer the ownership interest of another taxpayer.&#10;(Source: WESTS)
Chinese Term:归因
Translation:在某些情况下，税法会应用归因条例将一位付税人的所有权利息指派给另一位付税人。

Code:662

Code:680

Chinese Term: 雪崩保护
Translation: 为了保护人类，财产或者自然资源免受雪崩侵害而实施的方法与设备，包括雪崩预测与警告，雪崩地区的划分，滑雪测试以及使用炸药和其他设备来稳定雪崩区域。

Code:11921

Code:695
English Term:background radiation
Definition:Radiation resulting from natural sources, as opposed to man-made sources, and to which people are exposed in everyday, normal life; for example from rocks and soil.&#10;(Source: WRIGHT / MGH)
Chinese Term:背景辐射
Translation: 来自于自然界的辐射而非来自于人为来源的辐射，正常情况下人们每日都暴露于此辐射下，例如来自于岩石和土壤。


Code:699
English Term:bacterial bed
Definition:A device that removes some suspended solids from sewage. Air and bacteria decompose additional wastes filtering through the sand so that cleaner water drains from the bed.&#10;(Source: LEE)
Chinese Term:细菌床
Translation:用于去除污水中悬浮固体物质的装置。 由曝气和细菌分解从沙中过滤的废污，使干净的水得由细菌床中排出。



Code:700
English Term:bactericide

Chinese Term:杀菌剂
Translation:可以杀死细菌的物质。

Code:11639
English Term:bacteriological pollution
Definition:Contamination of water, soil and air with pathogen bacteria.&#10;(Source: RRDA)
Chinese Term:细菌学污染
Translation:被病原菌污染的水，土地或者空气。

Code:702
English Term:bacteriology
Definition:The science and study of bacteria.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:细菌学
Translation:研究细菌的科学。

Code:698
English Term:bacterium
Definition:Group of single-cell micro-organisms, the smallest of the living organisms. Some are vital to sustain life, while others are responsible for causing highly dangerous human diseases, such as anthrax, tetanus and tuberculosis. Bacteria are found everywhere, in the soil, water and air.&#10;(Source: MGH / WRIGHT)
Chinese Term:细菌
Translation: 单细胞的微小生物群，是最小的有生命的生物。 有的对维持生命关系重大，有的能导致严重的人类疾病，如炭疽、破伤风和结核。 细菌可在土壤、水、空气中普遍存在。


Code:709
English Term:balance (economic)
Definition:An equality between the sums total of the two sides of an account, or the excess on either side.&#10;(Source: WESTS)
Chinese Term:平衡（经济学）
Translation:一个账户两方面的总量相等，或者一方超过另一方。

Code:5088
English Term:balance of matter
Definition:A calculation to inventory material inputs versus outputs in a process system.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:物质平衡
Translation: 在一个处理系统中，清单所列物质输入与输出的计算。


Code:710
English Term:balancing of interests
Definition:Considering, weighing or counterbalancing the competing political or financial concerns of different parts of society, including industries, consumers, trade unions and other groups or organizations.&#10;(Source: OED / ISEP)
Chinese Term:利益平衡
Translation: 思考、权衡或平衡包含工业界、消费者、贸易协会与其他团体或组织等不同社会部门互相竞争的政治性或财务性议题。


Code:13552
English Term:bank (land)
Definition:The sloping side of any hollow in the ground, especially when bordering a river.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term:河岸（土地）
Translation:土地上与河流相邻的任意倾斜面。

Code:12204
English Term:bank protection
Definition:Engineering work which aims at the protection of banks of a river, or slopes of embankments along it, from erosion by the current of flow, from floods, etc.&#10;(Source: ECHO1a)
Chinese Term:河岸保护
Translation: 保护河岸或其边坡不受河水或洪水等侵蚀的工程。


Code:716
English Term:banking
Definition:Transactional business between any bank, an institution for safeguarding, exchanging, receiving and lending money, and that bank’s clients or customers.&#10;(Source: OED / RHW)
Chinese Term:银行业
Translation: 任何银行间的商业交易，从事于保险、汇兑、货币借贷、和服务客户或顾客的组织。


Code:719
English Term:barium
Definition:A soft silvery-white metallic element of the alkaline earth group. It is used in bearing alloys and compounds are used as pigments.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term:钡
Translation:较软的银白金属元素，属于碱金属。被用做轴承合金，其化合物用做颜料。

Code:10149
English Term:barrier beach
Definition:An elongated sand or shingle bank which lies parallel to the coastline and is not submerged by the tide. If it is high enough to permit dune growth it is termed a barrier island.&#10;(Source: WHIT)
Chinese Term:沿岸沙滩
Translation: 一个延伸的沙滩或卵石的堤岸，平行于海岸线且不被潮水淹没。 如果它高到足够允许沙丘增长，它就被称作堰洲岛。

Code:10175
English Term:barrier reef
Definition:An elongated accumulation of coral lying at low-tide level parallel to the coast but separated from it by a wide and deep lagoon or strait. The coral is thought to have formed initially on a flat surface: then as the sea-level rose in post-glacial times, thereby submerging the irregular wave-cut platform, the coral growth kept pace with the rising ocean level, so creating the great thickness witnessed today in such places as the Great Barrier Reef off the East coast of Queensland, Australia. This stretches for more than 1900 km and varies in width from about 30 km to 150 km.&#10;(Source: WHIT)
Chinese Term: 堤礁
Translation: 位于低潮水面的珊瑚堆积物，平行于海岸线且被又宽又深的泻湖或海峡分开。 珊瑚被认为最初在平面上形成：然后随着冰河期海平面的上升，不规则的波浪冲刷成的平台被淹没，珊瑚的生长和海平面的上升同步，因此造成了今天所看到的巨大的珊瑚礁，像澳大利亚昆士兰州东海岸线大堡礁。 它延伸了1900多公里，宽度从30公里到150公里不等。


Code:728
English Term:base (chemical)
Definition:Any chemical species, ionic or molecular, capable of accepting or receiving a proton (hydrogen ion) from another substance; the other substance acts as an acid in giving of the proton; the other ion is a base.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:碱
Translation: 任何能够从另一物质接受质子(氢离子)的化学物质，无论其为离子或分子；另一供应质子之物质作用为酸，而此化学物质就是碱。



Code:726
English Term:baseline monitoring
Definition:Monitoring of long-term changes in atmospheric compositions of particular significance to the weather and the climate.&#10;(Source: YOUNG)
Chinese Term:基线检测
Translation: 对于天气和气候有重要意义的大气成分长期变化，所进行的监测。

Code:730
English Term:basic food requirement
Definition:The minimum nutriments deemed necessary for a person of a particular age, gender, physiological condition and activity level to sustain life, health and growth.&#10;(Source: PAJ)
Chinese Term:基本食物需求
Translation:对于某个特定年龄，性别，物理状态以及活跃程度的人维持生命，健康和成长的最低营养需求。
Code:731
English Term:basicity
Definition:The state of a solution of containing an excess of hydroxyl ions.&#10;(Source: RRDA)
Chinese Term:碱性度
Translation:溶液中含有过量氢氧根离子的状态。
Code:733
English Term:basidiomycete
Chinese Term: 担子菌类

Code:4143
English Term:bastardisation of fauna
Definition:One of the possible consequences of the introduction of animal species in an area where they are not indigenous. Such translocation of species always involves an element of risk if not of serious danger. Newly arrived species may be highly competitive with or otherwise adversely affect native species and communities.&#10;(Source: RRDA / WPRa)
Chinese Term:动物种群相劣化
Translation: 某一地区由于引进非原生于该地的动物而造成的后果之一。 如此的迁移即使没有产生严重后果，但总是会有些许的危险性。 新到的品种可能具有很强的竞争性，或对原生物种和社群产生负面影响。

Code:4144
English Term:bastardisation of flora
Definition:One of the possible consequences of the introduction of plant species in an area where they are not indigenous.&#10;(Source: RRDA)
Chinese Term:植物群相劣化
Translation: 某一地区因引进非原生于此地的植物所造成的可能后果之一。

Code:736
English Term:batch process
Definition:A process that is not in continuous or mass production; operations are carried out with discrete quantities of material or a limited number of items.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term:批处理
Translation:不连续或者大量制造的处理过程。操作以离散数量的材料或者有限数量的物品而执行。

Code:12151
English Term:bathing freshwater
Definition:Freshwater in which bathing is explicitly authorised or in which bathing is not prohibited and is traditionally practised by a large number of bathers. Water in such areas must meet specified quality standards relating to chemical, microbiological and physical parameters.&#10;(Source: GILP96a)
Chinese Term:沐浴用淡水
Translation: 可被用来进行沐浴的淡水，这些水必须满足一定质量标准，包括化学成分，微生物以及其他物理参数方面。

Code:12166
English Term:bathing seawater
Definition:Sea waters in which bathing is explicitly authorised or in which bathing is not prohibited and is traditionally practised by a large number of bathers. Water in such areas must meet specified quality standards relating to chemical, microbiological and physical parameters.&#10;(Source: GILP96a)
Chinese Term:沐浴用海水
Translation:可被用来进行沐浴的海水，这些水必须满足一定质量标准，包括化学成分，微生物以及其他物理参数方面。


Code:740
English Term:bathing water
Definition:All waters, inland or coastal, except those intended for therapeutic purposes or used in swimming pools, an area either in which bathing is explicitly authorised or in which bathing is not prohibited and is traditionally practised by a large number of bathers. Water in such areas must meet specified quality standards relating to chemical, microbiological and physical parameters.&#10;(Source: GILP96)
Chinese Term:沐浴用水
Translation:除去被用做治疗用途或泳池里的所有内陆或海岸的水。在这个地域洗浴是被允许的而且很多人在此洗浴过。这些地域的水必须满足一定质量标准，包括化学成分，微生物以及其他物理参数方面。

Code:745
English Term:battery
Definition:A series of cells, each containing the essentials for producing voltaic electricity, connected together.&#10;(Source: CEDa)
Chinese Term:电池
Translation:一组连接到一起的原电池，每个都包含制造电流的必需成分。
Code:746
English Term:battery disposal
Chinese Term: 电池配置

Code:749
English Term:bay
English Term:An open, curving indentation made by the sea or a lake into a coastline.&#10;(Source: WHIT)
Chinese Term:海湾
Translation:形成于海或者湖的朝向海岸线的开阔，弯曲的缺口。
Code:751
English Term:beach
Definition:The unconsolidated material that covers a gently sloping zone, typically with a concave profile, extending landward from the low-water line to the place where there is a definite change in material or physiographic from (such as a cliff), or to the line of permanent vegetation (usually the effective limit of the highest storm waves); a shore of body of water, formed and washed by waves or tides, usually covered by sand or gravel, and lacking a bare rocky surface.&#10;(Source: BJGEO)
Chinese Term:海滩
Translation:覆盖一个逐渐倾斜地区的松散物质，一般是从一个有凹面的地方从浅水线延伸至陆地，而且有着明确的材质或地理上的物理变化（比如悬崖），或者延伸至永久植物线（通常对于限制风暴的最高波很有效。或者出现在水体的岸边，被波浪或浪潮冲刷而形成，通常被沙子或砾石覆盖，没有裸露的岩石表面。

Code: 12349
English Term: beach cleansing
Definition: The process of removing dirt, litter or other unsightly materials from shore line property or surrounding areas.&#10;(Source: ISEP)
Chinese Term: 海滩清洁
Translation: 清除海岸线以及周边地区的污垢、垃圾或其他难看的物质的过程。


Code: 755
English Term: beaching
Definition: The washing ashore of whales or other cetaceans that have died for natural causes, or because of highly polluted sea water or after being trapped in drift nets.&#10;(Source: WPRa)
Chinese Term:海滩堆积
Translation: 有死亡的鲸鱼或其他鲸目动物的岸边，这些动物因自然原因死亡或者因为高度污染的海水或在陷入流网之后死亡。


Code: 762
English Term: bee
Definition: Any of the membranous-winged insects which compose the superfamily Apoidea in the order Hymenoptera characterized by a hairy body and by sucking and chewing mouthparts.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 蜜蜂
Translation: 任何膜翅目（具有毛茸茸身体和吸吮咀嚼式口器的特征），组成蜜蜂总科的对膜翅昆虫。


Code: 760
English Term: bee conservation
Definition: The care, preservation and husbandry of hymenopterous insects valued for their ability to pollinate crops and other flora or for their production of honey.&#10;(Source: TOE / RHW)
Chinese Term: 蜜蜂保护？
Translation: 对膜翅类昆虫的关心、保护和养殖，重视它们授粉作物和其他植物或蜂蜜生产的能力。


Code: 761
English Term: beef cattle
Definition: Cattle bred for the production of meat.&#10;(Source: RRDA)
Chinese Term: 肉用牛
Translation: 用于肉类生产而饲养的牛。


Code: 764
English Term: beetle
Definition: Any insect of the order Coleoptera, having biting mouthparts and forewings modified to form shell-like protective elytra.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term: 甲虫
Translation: 任何鞘翅目昆虫，它们有咬人的口器和变化而形成壳状保护鞘翅的前翅。


Code: 765
English Term: behaviour
Definition: Any observable action or response of an organism, group or species to environmental factors.&#10;(Source: LBC)
Chinese Term: 行为

Translation: 一个相对统一的公开系列活动，并且可以看出一些规律。

Chinese Term: 行为科学
Translation: 对生物体的行为研究。


Code: 768
English Term: beneficial organism
Definition: Any pollinating insect, or any pest predator, parasite, pathogen or other biological control agent which functions naturally or as part of an integrated pest management program to control another pest.
Chinese Term: 有益生物
Translation: 任何有自然功能或者作为综合虫害管理方案的一部分来控制另外一种害虫的授粉昆虫，或任何害虫捕食者，寄生虫，病原体或其他生物控制剂。


Code: 772
English Term: benthic division
Definition: The bottom of a body of water often occupied by benthos.&#10;(Source: GILP96)
Chinese Term: 底栖
Translation: 经常被底栖生物占领的水体底部。


Code: 773
English Term: benthic ecosystem
Definition: The interacting system of the biological communities located at the bottom of bodies of freshwater and saltwater and their non-living environmental surroundings.&#10;(Source: TOE / DOE)
Chinese Term: 底栖生态系统
Translation: 位于淡水和咸水的底部及其非生物环境的生物群落的相互作用系统。


Code: 775
English Term: benthos
Definition: Those organisms attached to, living on, in or near the sea bed, river bed or lake floor.&#10;(Source: LBC)
Chinese Term: 底栖生物
Translation: 那些生活在海床中或附近，河床或湖底的生物。


Code: 776
English Term: benzene
Definition: A colorless, liquid, flammable, aromatic hydrocarbon used to manufacture styrene and phenol. Also known as benzol.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 苯
Translation: 一种被用来制造苯乙烯和苯酚的无色液体，易燃的芳烃。也叫不纯苯。


Code: 777
English Term: benzopyrene
Definition: A five-ring aromatic hydrocarbon found in coal tar, in cigarette smoke, and as a product of incomplete combustion.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 苯并芘
Translation: 一种在煤焦油、香烟烟雾中找到的五环芳香烃，是一种不完全燃烧的产物。


Code: 781
English Term: beryllium
Definition: A corrosion-resistant, toxic silvery-white metallic element that occurs chiefly in beryl and is used mainly in x-ray windows and in the manufacture of alloys.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term: 铍
Translation: 一种耐腐蚀，有毒的银白色金属元素，主要在绿柱石中出现，主要用于防X -射线的窗户和合金的制造。


Code: 782
English Term: beta radiation
Definition: Name given to the ionizing radiation which is produced as a stream of high speed electrons emitted by certain types of radioactive substance when they decay. The intensity of radiation energy produced in human tissue by a beta particle is a hundred times less than that produced by an alpha radiation particle, but it travels slightly deeper into tissue.&#10;(Source: WRIGHT)
Chinese Term: β辐射
Translation: 所给名称针对于电离辐射，一个高速的放射性物质衰变时，某些类型的发射电子流。由贝他粒子在人体组织产生的辐射的能量强度，比阿尔法辐射产生的少一百倍，但是它稍微深入到组织。


Code: 784
English Term: beverage
Definition: Any one of various liquids for drinking, usually excluding water.&#10;(Source: AMHER)
Chinese Term: 饮料
Translation: 任何一个可以饮用的液体，通常不包括水。

Code: 14879
English Term: bibliographic information
Definition: Data pertaining to the history, physical description, comparison, and classification of books and other works.&#10;(Source: RHW)
Chinese Term: 书目信息
Translation: 有关数据的历史，物理描述，比较，书籍和其他作品的分类。


Code: 14878
English Term: bibliographic information system
Definition: A coordinated assemblage of people, devices or other resources organized for the exchange of data pertaining to the history, physical description, comparison, and classification of books and other works.&#10;(Source: RHW)
Chinese Term: 书目信息系统
Translation: 一个关于人、设备或其他资源的协调组合物，用于有关数据的历史的交流、物理描述、比较、以及书籍和其他作品分类。

Code: 786
English Term: bibliography
Definition: A complete or selective listing of documents by a given subject, author or publisher, often including the description and identification of the editions, dates of issue, titles, authorship, publishers or other written materials.&#10;(Source: RHW / ISEP)
Chinese Term: 书目学 书刊目录,参考书目,书志学,目录学,文献学
Translation: 文档的完全的或者选择性的列表，根据一个给定的主题、作者、或者出版社，通常包含版本的描述和识别，发行日期、著作权、出版商或其他书面材料。


Code: 788
English Term: bicycle
Definition: A vehicle with two wheels in tandem, pedals connected to the rear wheel by a chain, handlebars for steering, and a saddlelike seat.
Chinese Term: 自行车
Translation: 一种车，它拥有两个同步的轮子，踏板通过链条连接后轮，为转向的把手，一个座椅和一个鞍。

Code: 10726
English Term: big game
Definition: Large wild animals that weigh typically more than 30 lb when fully grown, hunted for food, sport or profit.&#10;(Source: CORBIT /  AMHER)
Chinese Term: 大猎物
Translation: 完全长大时，体重通常超过30磅的大型野生动物，为了食物、运动或利润的追杀。


Code: 792
English Term: bilateral convention
Definition: An international agreement, especially one dealing with a specific matter, involving two or both sides, factions, or the like.&#10;(Source: RRDA)
Chinese Term: 双边公约
Translation: 一项国际协议，尤其是一个处理一个具体问题，涉及两个或两个方面，派别，或类似的。


Code: 794
English Term: bilge oil
Definition: Waste oil that accumulates, usually in small quantities, inside the lower spaces of a ship, just inside the shell plating, and usually mixed with larger quantities of water.&#10;(Source: ERG)
Chinese Term: 舱底油
Translation: 在船内的底层空间积累的通常少量的废油，在内壳板中，通常和大量的水混合在一起。


Code: 795
English Term: bilge water
Definition: Water that builds up in the bottom of a ship's bilge.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 舱底水
Translation: 装在船舶的舱底的底部的水。


Code: 798
English Term: bioaccumulation
Definition: 1) The accumulation of pollutants in living organisms by direct adsorption or through food chains. &#10;2) Accumulation by an organism of materials that are not an essential component or nutrient of that organism. Usually it refers to the accumulation of metals, but it can apply to bioaccumulation of persistent synthetic substances such as organochlorine compounds. Many organisms, such as plants, fungi and bacteria, will accumulate metals when grown in solutions containing them. The process can be employed usefully as a purification process to remove toxic heavy metals from waste water and contaminated land.&#10;(Source: WRIGHT)
Chinese Term: (有毒化学物质的) 生物体内积累
Translation: 1）通过直接吸收或者通过食物链，生物体内污染物的积累。&#10;2）不是生物体的基本组成或者营养物质的那样一些物质在生物体的积累。通常它指金属元素的积累，但是它适用于如有机氯化合物这样的持续合成物质的生物积累。许多生物，如植物，真菌和细菌，在含有金属元素的溶液中生长，就会积累金属元素。这一过程可用作为有效净化过程，从废水和污染土地中去除有毒重金属。


Code: 800
English Term: bioaccumulative pollutant
Definition: Pollutants that become concentrated in living organisms through the consumption of food or water.&#10;(Source: KORENa)
Chinese Term: 生物蓄积性污染物
Translation: 通过食物或水的消耗，在生物体中逐渐积累的污染物。


Code: 802
English Term: bio-availability
Definition: The extent to which a drug or other substance is taken up by a specific tissue or organ after administration.&#10;(Source: ZINZAN /  CEDa)
Chinese Term: 生物有效性
Translation: 药物或其他物质在实施后被特定组织或者有机体吸收的程度。


Code: 807
English Term: biochemical method
Definition: Method based on the utilisation of a biochemical mechanism, e.g. any chemical reaction or series of reactions, usually enzyme catalysed, which produces a given physiological effect in a living organism.&#10;(Source: BIOHW)
Chinese Term: 生化法
Translation: 基于生化机制的利用的方法，例如，任何一个化学反应或者任何一系列反应，通常需要酶催化，产生特定的活生物体上的生理效应。


Code: 947
English Term: biochemical oxygen demand
Definition: The amount of oxygen used for biochemical oxidation by a unit volume of water at a given temperature and for a given time. BOD is an index of the degree of organic pollution in water.&#10;(Source: LBC)
Chinese Term: 生化需氧量
Translation: 在特定温度和给定的时间内，单位体积的水生化氧化的耗氧量。BOD是水体有机污染的程度的指数。


Code: 812
English Term: biochemical process
Definition: Chemical processes occurring in living organisms.&#10;(Source: PHCa)
Chinese Term: 生化过程
Translation: 发生在活的有机体的化学过程。


Code: 813
English Term: biochemical substance
Definition: Chemical substances that occur in animals, microorganisms, and plants.&#10;(Source: GILP96a)
Chinese Term: 生化物质
Translation: 在动物，微生物，和植物中出现的化学物质。


Code: 815
English Term: biochemistry
Definition: The study of chemical substances occurring in living organisms and the reactions and methods for identifying these substances.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 生物化学
Translation: 对于在活的有机体中出现的化学物质、以及确定这些物质的反应和方法的研究。


Code: 816
English Term: biocide
Definition: A diverse group of poisonous substance including preservatives, insecticides, disinfectants and pesticides used for the control of organisms that are harmful to human or animal health or that cause damage to natural or manufactured products.&#10;(Source: GRAHAW)
Chinese Term: 生物杀灭剂
Translation: 一组多样的有毒物质，包括防腐剂，杀虫剂，消毒剂和用于生物控制的杀虫剂，有害于人类或动物健康，或者造成自然或人造产品的损害。


Code: 818
English Term: bioclimatology
Definition: The study of climate in relation to fauna and flora.&#10;(Source: LBC)
Chinese Term: 生物气候学
Translation: 有关动物和植物的气候的研究。


Code: 819
English Term: biocoenosis
Definition: A community or natural assemblage of organisms; often used as an alternative to ecosystem but strictly is the fauna/flora association excluding physical aspects of the environment.&#10;(Source: LBC)
Chinese Term: 生物群落
Translation: 一个群落或生物体的自然组合；经常被用作生态系统的替代，但是尤其是指不包括环境的物理因素的动物/植物团体。

Code: 820
English Term: bioconcentration factor
Definition: The quotient of the concentration of a chemical in aquatic organisms at a specific time or during a discrete time period of exposure, divided by the concentration in the surrounding water at the same time or during the same period.&#10;(Source: KOREN)
Chinese Term: 生物富集系数
Translation: 在特定时间或在离散的时间段，在水生生物中化学物质的浓度商数；在同时或者在同一个时间段，被周边水剂浓度，除得到的商。


Code: 821
English Term: biodegradability
Definition: The extent to which a substance can be decomposed - or rotted - by bacteria and fungi.  Implies that residues from degradation are nontoxic. One of the most misleading claims in business, because shoppers often assume a biodegradable product to be harmless. Some harmful compounds take much longer to degrade than others and the product can harm the environment while it is rotting. Biodegradation may also be incomplete, sometimes leaving residues in the environment which are more harmful than the original substance. Accumulation in the environment of nonbiodegradable (or poorly biodegradable) substances, such as some biocides, can cause serious problems.&#10;(Source: VCN)
Chinese Term: 生物降解
Translation: 物质被细菌和真菌分解或腐烂的程度。暗示降解的残留物的是无毒的。最有误导性的宣称之一就是从购买者经常假设生物降解产品无害。一些有害的复合需要比其他物质长得多的时间降解，而且在腐烂过程中生成的产品会破坏环境。生物降解可能也不完整，有时离开余数在环境——比原更更有害物质，有时会在环境中残留比原物质更加有害的物质。非生物降解(或不善生物降解的)物质在环境中的积累，例如一些杀菌剂，能引起严重问题。


Code: 823
English Term: biodegradable pollutant
Definition: A pollutant which can be converted by biological processes into simple inorganic molecules.&#10;(Source: RRDA)
Chinese Term: 可生物降解的污染物
Translation:



Code: 826
English Term: biodegradation
Definition: Breaking down of a substance by microorganisms.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 生物降解
Translation: 在微生物作用下分解物质。

Code: 827
English Term: biodiversity
Definition: 1) Genetic diversity: the variation between individuals and between populations within a species; species diversity: the different types of plants, animals and other life forms within a region; community or ecosystem diversity: the variety of habitats found within an area (grassland, marsh, and woodland for instance.&#10; 2) An umbrella term to describe collectively the variety and variability of nature. It encompasses three basic levels of organisation in living systems: the genetic, species, and ecosystem levels. Plant and animal species are the most commonly recognized units of biological diversity, thus public concern has been mainly devoted to conserving species diversity.&#10;(Source: WRES /  GILP96)
Chinese Term: 生物多样性
Translation: 遗传多样性：一个物种的个体间以及群体间的变异；物种多样性：在一个区域内的植物，动物和其他生命形式的不同类型；群体或生态系统多样性：在一个地区内的栖息地的多样性（例如草地，沼泽和林地）&#10;集中描述自然的多样性和变异性的总称。它包括生命系统的组织的三个基本层次：基因、物种和生态系统层。植物和动物物种是生物多样性最普遍认可的单位，因此，公众关注的主要是致力于保护物种多样性。


Code: 830
English Term: bioethics
Definition: The study of ethical problems arising from biological research and its applications in such fields as organ transplantation, genetic engineering, or artificial insemination.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term: 生物伦理学
Translation: 在那些器官移植、基因工程或者人工受精等领域中，生物学研究及其应用引起的伦理问题的研究。


Code: 12576
English Term: biofiltration
Definition: The distribution of settled sewage on a bed of inert granular material through which it is allowed to percolate. In doing so, the effluent is aerated thus allowing aerobic bacteria and fungi to reduce its biochemical oxygen demand.&#10;(Source: PORT)
Chinese Term: 生物过滤
Translation: 污水在惰性颗粒材料（通过它允许渗透）的环境中的分布。这样做可以使污水与氧结合，从而使好氧细菌和真菌减少它们生化需氧量。


Code: 12011
English Term: biofuel
Definition: A gaseous, liquid, or solid fuel that contains an energy content derived from a biological source. The organic matter that makes up living organisms provides a potential source of trapped energy that is beginning to be exploited to supply the ever-increasing energy demand around the world. An example of a biofuel is rapeseed oil, which can be used in place of diesel fuel in modified engines. The methyl ester of this oil, rapeseed methyl ester (RME), can be used in unmodified diesel engines and is sometimes known as biodiesel. Other biofuels include biogas and gasohol.&#10;(Source: DICCHE)
Chinese Term: 生物燃料
Translation: 一种从生物源得到的含有能量的气体、液体或者固体燃料。组成有机体的有机物，为被困能源提供了潜在的来源，开始在全世界被用来满足不断增加的能源需求。生物燃料的一个例子是菜籽油，它可以用来替代改良发动机的柴油。这种油酸甲酯，油菜籽甲基酯（RME），可以在未修改的柴油发动机中被使用，它有时候被当做生物柴油。其他一些生物燃料有沼气和乙醇汽油。

Code: 832
English Term: biogas
Definition: Gas, rich in methane, which is produced by the fermentation of animal dung, human sewage or crop residues in an air-tight container. It is used as a fuel, to heat stoves, lamps, run small machines and to generate electricity. The residues of biogas production are used as a low-grade organic fertilizer. Biogas fuels do not usually cause any pollution to the atmosphere, and because they come from renewable energy resources they have great potential for future use.&#10;(Source: WRIGHT)
Chinese Term: 沼气
Translation: 气体，富含甲烷，由动物粪便、人类排泄物或者作物残留物在密闭的容器中发酵产生，它被用作的一种燃料，给灶、灯加热，运行小型机器设备以及发电。生产沼气的残留物是用来作为一种低级的有机肥料。沼气燃料通常不会造成任何污染大气，并且因为他们来自可再生能源资源，它们对未来的使用潜力巨大。


Code: 833
English Term: biogeochemical cycle
Definition: Movement of chemical elements in a circular pathway, from organisms to physical environment, back to organisms. The process is termed a nutrient cycle if the elements concerned are trace elements, which are essential to life. A biogeochemical cycle occurs when vegetation decomposes and minerals are incorporated naturally in the humus for future plant growth.&#10;(Source: WRIGHT)
Chinese Term: 生物地理化学循环
Translation: 化学元素的运动循环，从生物到物理环境，回到生物。如果相关元素是微量元素，这个过程被称为一个养分循环，是生命的基础。一个生物地理化学循环发生在植被分解，矿物为未来植物生长被自然用于腐殖质。


Code: 834
English Term: biogeochemistry
Definition:
Chinese Term: 生物地球化学
Translation:


Code: 835
English Term: biogeographical region
Definition: Area of the Earth's surface defined by the species of fauna and flora it contains.&#10;(Source: ALL)
Chinese Term: 生物地理区域
Translation: 根据所包含的动植物物种来定义的地球表面区域。


Code: 836
English Term: biogeography
Definition: The science concerned with the geographical distribution of animal and plant life.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 生物地理学(研究动植物的地理分布)
Translation: 与动物和植物的地理分布有关的科学。


Code: 839
English Term: biological activity
Definition:
Chinese Term: 生物活性
Translation:


Code: 841
English Term: biological analysis
Definition: The analysis of a substance in order to ascertain its influence on living organisms.&#10;(Source: PHCa)
Chinese Term: 生物分析
Translation: 为了确定对生物的影响，对物质进行的分析。


Code: 842
English Term: biological attribute
Definition: Properties or features belonging to living organisms.&#10;(Source: CEDa)
Chinese Term: 生物属性
Translation: 属于生物体的属性或特征。


Code: 11675
English Term: biological contamination
Definition: The presence in the environment of living organisms or agents derived by viruses, bacteria, fungi, and mammal and bird antigens that can cause many health effects.&#10;(Source: KORENa)
Chinese Term: 生物污染
Translation: 环境中那些可导致许多健康问题的现象，这些现象由生物体或由病毒、细菌、真菌、哺乳动物和鸟类抗原因素引起。


Code: 13118
English Term: biological cycle
Definition: A series of transformations or biological events which follow one after the other one, reaching at the end of the cycle the initial conditions, as in the life cycle of many animal and plant organisms.&#10;(Source: DELFIN)
Chinese Term: 生物周期
Translation: 从初始状态开始到达周期结束又达到初始条件的过程中的一系列生物事件的转换，正如许多动物和植物的生命周期。

Code: 846
English Term: biological development
Definition: The action of growing of living organisms.&#10;(Source: RRDA)
Chinese Term: 生物发展
Translation: 生物生长的活动。


Code: 849
English Term: biological effect
Definition: Biological effects include allergic reactions, respiratory disorders, hypersensitivity diseases and infectious diseases and can be caused by a variety of contaminants and pollutants.&#10;(Source: RRDA)
Chinese Term: 生物效应
Translation: 生物效应包括过敏反应，呼吸失调，过敏性疾病，传染性疾病，可以由各种原因造成的污染和污染物。


Code: 11678
English Term: biological effect of pollution
Definition: Effects of pollution on living systems.&#10;(Source: RRDA)
Chinese Term: 污染的生物效应
Translation: 污染对生物系统的的影响。


Code: 851
English Term: biological engineering
Definition: The application of engineering principles and techniques to living organisms. It is largely concerned with the design of replacement body parts, such as limbs, heart valves, etc.&#10;(Source: UVAROV)
Chinese Term: 生物工程
Translation: 工程原理和技术在生物体的应用。它在很大程度上涉及如更换假肢、心脏瓣膜等身体部位的取代设计。


Code: 10136
English Term: biological heritage
Definition: The inheritance and preservation of the earth's or a particular region's balanced, integrated functionality as a natural habitat, with special concern for the water resources necessary to maintain the ecosystem.&#10;(Source: TOE)
Chinese Term: 生物遗产
Translation: 对地球或者某个作为一个自然栖息地的特定区域的均衡和综合功能的继承和保护，尤其是对水资源需求的特别关注，以维持生态系统。


Code: 856
English Term: biological indicator
Definition: A species or organism that is used to grade environmental quality or change.&#10;(Source: ALL)
Chinese Term: 生物标志物
Translation: 用于指示环境质量或变化的一个物种或生物，

Code: 861
English Term: biological monitoring
Definition: The direct measurement of changes in the biological status of a habitat, based on evaluations of the number and distribution of individuals or species before and after a change.&#10;(Source: ALL)
Chinese Term: 生物监测
Translation: 基于个体或物种的数量和分布的前后变化的测评，对生物的栖息地状况的变化直接测量。


Code: 862
English Term: biological nitrogen fixation
Definition:
Chinese Term: 生物固氮
Translation:



Code: 864
English Term: biological pest control
Definition: Any living organism applied to or introduced into the environment that is intended to function as a pesticide against another organism declared to be a pest.&#10;(Source: LEE)
Chinese Term: 生物虫害控制
Translation: 任何适用于或者被引进到环境中作为害虫的杀虫剂的生物体。


Code: 865
English Term: biological pollutant
Definition: Viruses, bacteria, fungi, and mammal and bird antigens that may be present in the environment and cause many health effects.&#10;(Source: KORENa)
Chinese Term: 生物污染物
Translation: 可存在于环境中，导致许多健康影响的那些病毒，细菌，真菌和哺乳动物和鸟类抗原。


Code: 866
English Term: biological pollution
Definition: Disturbance of the ecological balance by the accidental or deliberate introduction of a foreign organism, animal or plant species into an environment.&#10;(Source: WRIGHT)
Chinese Term: 生物污染
Translation: 意外地或故意把外来生物引进到环境中，对生态平衡造成的紊乱。


Code: 867
English Term: biological process
Definition: Processes concerning living organisms.&#10;(Source: CEDa)
Chinese Term: 生物过程
Translation: 与生物体有关的过程。


Code: 868
English Term: biological production
Definition: 1) The amount and rate of production which occur in a given ecosystem over a given time period. It may apply to a single organism, a population, or entire communities and ecosystems.&#10; 2) The quantity of organic matter or its equivalent in dry matter, carbon, or energy content which is accumulated during a given period of time.&#10;(Source: PARCOR /  MGH)
Chinese Term: 生物生产
Translation: 1）在一个特定的生态系统发生在一个特定时期的生产的数量和速率。它可以适用于一个单一的有机体，一个物群，或整个社区和生态系统。&#10;2）在一段特定时期累计的有机物质的数量，或者它在干物重、碳或者能量含量方面的等价物的数量。


Code: 7137
English Term: biological reserve
Definition: An area of land and/or of water designated as having protected status for purposes of preserving certain biological features. Reserves are managed primarily to safeguard these features and provide opportunities for research into the problems underlying the management of natural sites and of vegetation and animal populations. Regulations are normally imposed controlling public access and disturbance.&#10;(Source: GOOD)
Chinese Term: 生物保护区
Translation: 为保存某些生物特征而故意保护某一块地域或者水域的状态。保存主要是为了保障这些特征并且提供机会以便深入研究在自然遗址、植被和动物种群管理上的问题。通常要制定条例来控制公共进入和干扰。


Code: 873
English Term: biological resource
Definition: Wild organisms harvested for subsistence, commerce, or recreation (such as fish, game, timber or furbearers); domesticated organisms raised by agriculture, aquaculture, and silviculture; and ecosystems cropped by livestock.&#10;(Source: WPR)
Chinese Term: 生物资源
Translation: 为生活、商业或娱乐（例如鱼，野味，木材或毛皮动物）获得的野生生物；农业、水产养殖、林业驯养的生物以及附近的的生态系统。

Code: 11771
English Term: biological test
Definition: The laboratory determination of the effects of substances upon specific living organisms.&#10;(Source: GILP96)
Chinese Term: 生物活性测试
Translation: 物质对特定的活生物体影响的实验室测定。


Code: 12601
English Term: biological treatment
Definition: Process that uses microorganisms to decompose organic wastes either into water, carbon dioxide, and simple inorganic substances, or into simpler organic substances, such as aldehydes and acids. The purpose of a biological treatment system is to control the environment for microorganisms so that their growth and activity are enhanced, and provide a means for maintaining high concentration of the microorganisms in contact with the wastes.&#10;(Source: PARCOR)
Chinese Term: 生物处理
Translation: 使用微生物将有机物分解成水、二氧化碳和简单的无机物，或者简单的有机物，如醛和酸。一个生物处理系统的目的是控制的微生物的环境，来增强它们的生长和活动，并为维护与废弃物接触高浓度的微生物方法。提供一个方法来维持那些与废弃物接触的微生物的高浓度。


Code: 878
English Term: biological waste gas purification
Definition: Processes for removing impurities from waste gas based on the employing of microorganisms.&#10;(Source: BIOTGLa)
Chinese Term: 生物废气处理
Translation: 从使用微生物得到的废气中去除杂质的过程。


Code: 879
English Term: biological waste treatment
Definition: A generic term applied to processes that use microorganisms to decompose organic wastes either into water, carbon dioxide, and simple inorganic substances, such as aldehydes and acids. The purpose of biological waste treatment is to control either the environment for microorganisms so that their growth and activity are enhanced, and to provide a means for maintaining high concentrations of the microorganisms in contact with the wastes.
Chinese Term: 生物废物处理
Translation: 一个适用于使用微生物分解有机物的过程的通用术语。微生物把有机废弃物分解成水、二氧化碳和简单的无机物质，如醛和酸。对生物废料处理的目的是控制微生物的环境使得它们的生长和活动得到增强，并且提供一个方法来维护与废弃物接触得微生物的高浓度。

Code: 12287
English Term: biological wastewater treatment
Definition: Types of wastewater treatment in which biochemical or bacterial action is intensified to oxidize and stabilize the unstable organic matter present. Examples of this type of treatment use intermittent sand filters, trickling filters, and activated sludge processes and sludge digestion.&#10;(Source: WWC)
Chinese Term: 生物废水处理
Translation: 废水处理的类型，通过生化或细菌作用，使目前的不稳定有机质被氧化和变得稳定。这种类型的例子，是使用间歇性砂过滤器，滴滤池，活性污泥法处理及污泥消化。


Code: 9149
English Term: biological water balance
Definition: The amount of ingoing and outgoing water in a system, which are assumed to be equal in the long term so that the water budget will balance.&#10;(Source: ALL)
Chinese Term: 生物水平衡
Translation: 在一个系统中水的出入量，这是假设在长期情况下，出入量相等，从而使得水的预算平衡。


Code: 880
English Term: biological weapon
Definition: Living organisms (or infective material derived from them) which are intended to cause disease or death in animals, plants, or man, and which depend for their effects on their ability to multiply in the person, animal or plant attacked. Various living organisms (for example, rickettsiae, viruses and fungi), as well as bacteria, can be used as weapons.&#10;(Source: WPR)
Chinese Term: 生物武器
Translation: 生物体（或从中得到的感染性物质），它们造成疾病或动物、植物或人死亡，并依靠他们对在受被攻击的人、动物或植物中自身复制能力的影响。各种生物体（例如，立克次氏体，病毒和真菌），和细菌一样，可以作为武器。


Code: 881
English Term: biology
Definition: A division of the natural sciences concerned with the study of life and living organisms.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 生物学
Translation: 涉及生命和活的有机体的研究，是自然科学的一个分支。


Code: 882
English Term: bioluminescence
Definition: The production of light of various colors by living organisms (e.g. some bacteria and fungi, glow-worms and many marine animals). Luminescence is produced by a biochemical reaction, which is catalyzed by an enzyme. In some animals the light is used as a mating signal; in others it may be a protective device. In deep-sea forms luminous organs may serve as lanterns.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 生物发光
Translation: 通过生物生产各种颜色的光（例如，一些细菌和真菌，夜光虫和许多海洋动物）。发光是由生化反应产生的，由酶催化。在一些动物中，光线被用作动物交配的信号;在另外一些动物中，光是一种保护设施。深海中的发光组织可以作为灯笼。


Code: 11672
English Term: biomarker
Definition: A normal metabolite that, when present in abnormal concentrations in certain body fluids, can indicate the presence of a particular disease or toxicological condition.&#10;(Source: DICCHE)
Chinese Term: 生物标记
Translation: 一个正常的代谢物，当在某些体液中的浓度异常时，可以显示出某种疾病或毒性状况的存在。


Code: 883
English Term: biomass
Definition: Biomass refers strictly speaking to the total weight of all the living things in an ecosystem. However, it has come to refer to the amount of plant and crop material that could be produced in an ecosystem for making biofuels and other raw materials used in industry, for example.&#10;(Source: WRIGHT)
Chinese Term: 生物量
Translation: 严格来说，生物量是指在生态系统中的所有生物的重量。然而，它已经被用来指，在一个生态系统中，可以产生的可以用于制造生物燃料和工业用其他原料的植物或者农作物的数量。


Code: 885
English Term: biomass energy
Definition: A renewable energy source that makes use of such biofuels as methane (biogas) generated by sewage, farm, industrial, or household organic waste materials. Other biofuels include trees grown in so-called "energy forests" or other plants, such as sugar cane, grown for their energy potential. Biomass energy relies on combustion and therefore produces carbon dioxide; its use would not, therefore, alleviate the greenhouse effect.&#10;(Source: UVAROV)
Chinese Term: 生物质能（iciba）生物量能量(台)
Translation: 可再生能源，利用生物燃料，例如从污水、农业、工业、或家庭产生的有机废弃物中得到甲烷（沼气）。其他生物燃料包括在"能源森林"中生长的树或其他的植物，例如甘蔗，增长为他们的能源潜力。生物质能依靠燃烧，因此生产二氧化碳;因此，它的利用不能缓和温室效应。




Code: 888
English Term: biophysics
Definition: The hybrid science involving the application of physical principles and methods to study and explain the structures of living organisms and the mechanics of life processes.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 生物物理学
Translation: 一种混合科学，涉及到物理原理和方法的应用以研究和解释生物结构和生命过程的力学。


Code: 889
English Term: bioreactor
Definition: A container, such as a large fermentation chamber, for growing living organisms that are used in the industrial production of substances such as pharmaceuticals, antibodies, or vaccines.&#10;(Source: PORT)
Chinese Term: 生物反应器
Translation: 一个供生物体生长的容器，如大型发酵室，用于工业生产制药，抗体或疫苗等。


Code: 890
English Term: biorhythm
Definition: A cyclically recurring pattern of physiological states in an organism or organ, such as alpha rhythm or circadian rhythm; believed by some to affect physical and mental states and behaviour.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term: 生物节律
Translation: 一种在有生物体或器官中的生理状态的周期性循环模式，例如阿尔法节律或者昼夜节律；某些人相信它可以影响身体和心理状态以及行为。

Code: 891
English Term: biosafety
Definition: The combination of knowledge, techniques and equipment used to manage or contain potentially infectious materials or biohazards in the laboratory environment, to reduce or prevent harm to laboratory workers, other persons and the environment.&#10;(Source: BIOSAF / OHS)
Chinese Term: 生物安全
Translation: 生物安全是一种知识、技术和设备的结合，为了减少或避免损害实验室工作人员、其他人员和环境，用来在实验室环境中管理或者容纳潜在的传染性物质或生物危害。


Code: 892
English Term: biosphere
Definition: That part of the Earth and atmosphere capable of supporting living organisms.&#10;(Source: LBC)
Chinese Term: 生物圈
Translation: 地球和大气能够支持生物体的部分。


Code: 894
English Term: biosphere reserve
Definition: Protected land and coastal areas that are approved under the Man and Biosphere programme (MAB) in conjunction with the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species (CITES). Each reserve has to have an ecosystem that is recognized for its diversity and usefulness as a conservation unit. The reserves have at least one core area where there can be no interference with the natural ecosystem. A transition zone surrounds this and within it scientific research is allowed. Beyond this is a buffer zone which protects the whole reserve from agricultural, industrial and urban development. Biosphere reserves and buffer zones were regarded as examples of a new generation of conservation techniques.&#10;(Source: WRIGHT)
Chinese Term: 生物圈保护区
Translation: 在人与生物圈计划（MAB）和对濒危野生动植物种国际贸易公约（CITES）中一致通过的，受保护的土地或沿海地区。每个保护区有一个因它作为保护单位的多样性和实用性受到认可的生态系统，。这些保护区至少有一个核心领域，不能受到自然生态系统的任何干扰。围绕围绕这个的过渡地带，过渡地带允许科学研究。除此之外，是一个保护整个保护区免受农业、工业和城市发展影响的的缓冲地带。生物圈保护区和缓冲区被视为一种新一代保护技术的例子。


Code: 895
English Term: biosynthesis
Definition: Production, by synthesis or degradation, of a chemical compound by a living organism.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 生物合成
Translation: 在活的有机体中，通过合成或降解生产化学化合物的。


Code: 12814
English Term: biotechnological hazard
Definition: A danger to humans, animals or the environment posed by the application of advanced biological techniques in the manufacture of industrial products, such as the risk or harm that results from exposure to infectious bacteria, viruses or fungi.&#10;(Source: APD / FFD)
Chinese Term: 生物技术风险
Translation: 一个对人类、动物或环境造成的危险，它是由先进的生物技术在工业产品的生产应用所带来的，例如从接触到感染细菌，病毒或真菌造成的风险或者伤害。


Code: 898
English Term: biotechnology
Definition: A combination of biology and technology. It is used to describe developments in the application of biological organisms for commercial and scientific purposes. So "bio" stands for biology and the science of life, and "tech" stands for technology, or the tools and techniques that the biotechnologists have in their workbox. Those tools and techniques include microorganisms and a range of methods for manipulating them, such as genetic engineering.&#10;(Source: WRIGHT)
Chinese Term: 生物技术
Translation: 生物学与技术的结合。它是用来描述在商业和科学用途的生物有机体的应用发展。因此，“bio”代表生物学和生命科学，“tech”代表在生物技术家们拥有的技术或工具和技术，这些工具和技术包含微生物和一系列用于操作它们的方法，如基因工程。


Code: 899
English Term: biotic factor
Definition: The influence upon the environment of organisms owing to the presence and activities of other organisms, as distinct from a physical, abiotic, environmental factor.&#10;(Source: ALL2)
Chinese Term: 生物因素
Translation: 由于存在和其他生物有机体的活动对生物环境的影响。不同于物理、非生物、环境因素。


Code: 11786
English Term: biotic index
Definition: Scale for showing the quality of an environment by indicating the types of organisms present in it (e.g. how clean a river is).&#10;(Source: PHC)
Chinese Term: 生物指数
Translation: 是通过指示目前的生物种类来显示环境质量的一种量度。


Code: 901
English Term: biotope
Definition: A region of relatively uniform environmental conditions, occupied by a given plant community and its associated animal community.&#10;(Source: PAENS)
Chinese Term: 群落生境
Translation: 一个环境条件相对比较统一的地区，被一个给定的植物群落以及与其相关的动物群落占领。


Code: 902
English Term: biotope network
Definition: Intersection of corridors connecting patchy ecological communities. Species survival tends to be higher in patches that have higher connectivity.&#10;(Source: PARCORa)
Chinese Term: 群落生境网络
Translation: 连接疏散的生态群落的交叉口。物种在与其他物种联系更紧密时，它们的生存趋向于更高级。


Code: 10189
English Term: biotope order
Definition: An ordinance or decree regarding an area of ecological habitat that is characterized by a high degree of uniformity in its environmental conditions and in its distribution of plants and animals.&#10;(Source: DOE /  OED)
Chinese Term: 群落生境秩序
Translation: 针对生态栖息地的法令或法规。生态栖息地的特点是，环境条件和植物和动物的分布高度一致。


Code: 903
English Term: biotope protection
Definition: Measures taken to ensure that the biological and physical components of a biotope are in equilibrium by maintaining constant their relative numbers and features.&#10;(Source: GILP96a)
Chinese Term: 群落生境保护
Translation: 通过保持恒定的相对数量和特征以确保一个群落生境的生物和物理组件处于均衡状态，而采取的措施，。

Code: 912
English Term: bird
Definition: Any of the warm-blooded vertebrates which make up the class Aves.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 鸟
Translation: 任何组成鸟类的恒温脊椎动物。

Code: 914
English Term: bird of prey
Definition: Any of various carnivorous bird of the orders Falconiformes and Strigiformes which feed on meat taken by hunting.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 猛禽
Translation: 隼形目和鸮形目（捕猎食肉）的食肉鸟类。

Code: 913
English Term: bird sanctuary
Definition: Special area where birds are protected.&#10;(Source: PHC)
Chinese Term: 鸟类保护区
Translation: 鸟类受保护的特定区域。

Code: 915
English Term: bird species
Definition: Any species of the warm-blooded vertebrates which make up the class Aves.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 鸟种类
Translation: 组成鸟类的，属于恒温脊椎动物的任何物种。

Code: 917
English Term: birth control
Definition: Limitation of the number of children born by preventing or reducing the frequency of impregnation.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 计划生育
Translation: 通过防止或减少受精，来限制出生子女的数目。

Code: 921
English Term: bitumen
Definition: A generic term applied to natural inflammable substances of variable colour, hardness, and volatility, composed principally of a mixture of hydrocarbons substantially free from oxygenated bodies. Bitumens are sometimes associated with mineral matter, the nonmineral constituents being fusible and largely soluble in carbon disulfide, yielding water-insoluble sulfonation products. Petroleum, asphalts, natural mineral waxes, and asphaltites are all considered bitumens.&#10;(Source: BJGEO)
Chinese Term: 沥青
Translation: 一个通用的术语适用于那些自然易燃物质，该物质颜色、硬度可变，具有挥发性，主要由从含氧机体中得到的碳氢化合物的混合物组成。沥青有时候和矿物质相联系，易燃的，可大量融于二硫化碳（水不溶性磺化产品）的非矿物质的成分。石油，沥青，天然矿物蜡及沥青柏油都被认为是沥青。


Code: 926
English Term: black coal
Definition: A natural black graphitelike material used as a fuel, formed from fossilized plants and consisting of amorphous carbon with various organic and some inorganic compounds.&#10;(Source: AMHER)
Chinese Term: 黑煤
Translation: 一种作为燃料的自然黑色类石墨材料，由植物化石形成，并且组成各种有机和一些无机化合物的无定形碳。


Code: 14842
English Term: Black Sea
Definition: No definition needed.
Chinese Term: 黑海
Translation:



Code: 930
English Term: blast furnace
Definition: A tall, cylindrical smelting furnace for reducing iron ore to pig iron; the blast of air blown through solid fuel increases the combustion rate.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 高炉
Translation: 一个高大的为减少铁矿石冶炼生铁的圆柱形炉；吹入空气来增加固体燃料的燃烧率。


Code: 932
English Term: bleaching agent
Definition: 1) A chemical, such as an aromatic acyl peroxide or monoperoxiphthalic acid, used to bleach flour, fats, oils and other edibles. &#10;2) An oxidizing or reducing chemical such as sodium hypochlorite, sulfur dioxide, sodium acid sulfite, or hydrogen peroxide.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 漂白剂
Translation: 1)一种化学物质，如芳香酰基过氧化物或monoperoxiphthalic酸，用来漂白面粉，油脂，油和其他食品。&#10;2)一种氧化还原物，如次氯酸钠，二氧化硫，亚硫酸盐钠酸，或过氧化氢。


Code: 933
English Term: bleaching clay
Definition: Clay capable of chemically adsorbing oils, insecticides, alkaloids, vitamins, carbohydrates and other materials; it is used for refining and decolorizing mineral and vegetable oils.&#10;(Source: WRES)
Chinese Term: 漂白黏土
Translation: 这种粘土有化学吸附油脂、杀虫剂、生物碱、维生素、碳水化合物和其他材料的能力；它是用于提炼和脱色矿物和植物油。


Code: 934
English Term: bleaching process
Definition: 1) Removing colored components from a textile. Common bleaches are hydrogen peroxide, sodium hypochloride, and sodium chlorite. &#10;2) The brightening and delignification of pulp by the addition of oxidizing chemicals such as chlorine or reducing chemicals such as sodium hypochloride.&#10;(Source: LEE)
Chinese Term: 漂白过程
Translation: 1.去除纺织品色组成部分。普通漂白剂有过氧化氢，次氯酸钠和亚氯酸钠。&#10;2.纸浆的漂白和木素脱通过添加氧化物来实现，如氯，或者还原物，如次氯酸钠。


Code: 935
English Term: blood (tissue)
Definition: A fluid connective tissue consisting of the plasma and cells that circulate in the blood vessels.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 血液（组织）
Translation: 一种在血管中循环的，由血浆和细胞组成的，液状结缔组织。


Code: 939
English Term: blue-green alga
Definition: Microorganisms, formerly classified as algae but now regarded as bacteria, including nostoc, which contain a blue pigment in addition to chlorophyll.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term: 蓝绿色藻类
Translation: 微生物，原属于藻类，但现在被视为细菌，包括念珠藻（除了含有叶绿素外，还含有蓝色色素）。


Code: 945
English Term: boating
Definition: To travel or go in a boat as a form of recreation.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term: 划船
Translation: 在船上旅行或作为一种娱乐。


Code: 10217
English Term: bocage
Definition: The wooded countryside characteristic of northern France, with small irregular-shaped fields and many hedges and copses. In the French language the word bocage refers both to the hedge itself and to a landscape consisting of hedges. Bocage landscapes usually have a slightly rolling landform, and are found mainly in maritime climates. Being a small-scale, enclosed landscape, the bocage offers much variations in biotopes, with habitats for birds, small mammals, amphibians, reptiles and butterflies.&#10;(Source: CED /  DOBRIS)
Chinese Term: 用树木围隔的田地或草地
Translation: 法国北部的丛林农村的特点，小而不规则，并有许多树篱和灌木。在法语中，bocage既指树篱本身又指由树篱组成的景观。Bocage景观通常是稍微弯曲的地貌，主要在海上气候的地区出现。作为一个小规模的、封闭的景观，bocage为不同的群落提供了栖息地，有鸟类、小型哺乳动物、两栖动物、爬行动物和蝴蝶等。


Code: 12161
English Term: bog
Definition: A commonly used term in Scotland and Ireland for a stretch waterlogged, spongy ground, chiefly composed of decaying vegetable matter, especially of rushes, cotton grass, and sphagnum moss.&#10;(Source: WHIT)
Chinese Term: 沼泽
Translation: 一个术语，经常用来描述苏格兰和爱尔兰的延伸的水浸的海绵地面，主要由腐烂的植物构成，特别是灯心草，棉花草，水苔。


Code: 953
English Term: boiler
Definition: An enclosed vessel in which water is heated and circulated, either as hot water or as steam, for heating or power.&#10;(Source: AMHER)
Chinese Term: 锅炉
Translation: 一个封闭的容器，无论是热水或蒸汽都被循环加热，用来加热或产生动力。


Code: 954
English Term: boiling point
Definition: The temperature at which the transition from the liquid to the gaseous phase occurs in a pure substance at fixed pressure.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 沸点
Translation: 在一个固定的压力下，一种纯净物从液体变成气体的最低温度。


Code: 959
English Term: book
Definition: A collection of leaves of paper, parchment or other material, usually bound or fastened together within covers, containing writing of any type or blank pages for future inscription.&#10;(Source: CCL / RHW)
Chinese Term: 书
Translation: 由若干页纸，羊皮纸或其他材料组成的集合，通常夹在封皮装订好，包含任何写作类型的纸或者为将来题词用得空白纸张。


Code: 961
English Term: bookkeeping
Definition: The art or science of recording business accounts and transactions.&#10;(Source: WESTS)
Chinese Term: 簿记
Translation: 专门用来记录商业账目或者交易。


Code: 963
English Term: border
Definition: The dividing line or frontier between political or geographic regions.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term: 边境
Translation: 政治或地理区域之间的分界线或者边疆。


Code: 965
English Term: boron
Definition: A very hard almost colourless crystalline metalloid element that in impure form exists as a brown amorphous powder. It occurs principally in borax and is used in hardening steel.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term: 硼
Translation: 一种非常坚硬的无色的非金属晶体元素，以不纯的形式存在于一种棕色无定形粉末。它主要出现在硼砂中，并在硬化钢中使用。

Code: 976
English Term: boundary layer
Definition: The layer of fluid adjacent to a physical boundary in which the fluid motion is significantly affected by the boundary and has a mean velocity less than the free stream value.&#10;(Source: LBC)
Chinese Term: 边界层
Translation: 与物理边界相邻的流体层，其中边界对流体运动有重大影响，具有平均流速低于自由流的值。

Code: 984
English Term: brackish water
Definition: Water, salty between the concentrations of fresh water and sea water; usually 5-10 parts x thousand.&#10;(Source: LANDY)
Chinese Term: 淡海水
Translation: 盐度介于淡水和海水盐分浓度之间的水;usually 5-10 parts x thousand.



Code: 986
English Term: bradyseism
Definition: A long-continued, extremely slow vertical instability of the crust, as in the volcanic district west of Naples, Italy, where the Phlegraean bradyseism has involved up-and-down movements between 6 m below sea level and 6 m above over a period of more than 2.000 years.&#10;(Source: BJGEO)
Chinese Term: 海陆运动   地壳的缓慢升降运动  ？？
Translation: 地壳的长期持续的、极其缓慢的垂直不稳定性，如在那不勒斯、意大利火山区西部，在超过2000年的时间里，Phlegraean海陆运动涉及了海拔6m以上和6m以下的升降运动。

Code: 997
English Term: brewing industry
Definition: A sector of the economy in which an aggregate of commercial enterprises is engaged in the manufacture and marketing of beverages made from malt and hops by steeping, boiling and fermentation, such as beer, ale and other related beverages.&#10;(Source: RHW)
Chinese Term: 酿造业
Translation: 一个经济分支，指那些从事饮品制造和销售的商业企业，它们通过浸泡、煮沸、发酵，用麦芽和啤酒花作为原料来制造及销售饮品，如啤酒，汽水及其他相关饮料。

English Term: bridge
Definition: A structure that spans and provides a passage over a road, railway, river, or some other obstacle.&#10;(Source: CED)

Code: 10568
English Term: broad-leaved tree
Definition: Deciduous tree which has wide leaves, as opposed to the needles on conifers.&#10;(Source: PHC)
Chinese Term: 阔叶树
Translation: 树叶宽大的落叶乔木，与针叶林相对。


Code: 1007
English Term: bromine
Definition: A pungent dark red volatile liquid element of the halogen series that occurs in brine and is used in the production of chemicals.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term: 溴
Translation: 挥发性、刺激性的暗红色液体，属于卤素元素系列，用于化学品的生产。


Code: 1014
English Term: brooding
Definition: To incubate eggs or cover the young for warmth.&#10;(Source: MGH)
Chinese Term: 孵卵
Translation: 为了孵化鸡蛋或覆盖取暖。


Code: 1015
English Term: brook
Definition: A small stream or rivulet, commonly swiftly flowing in rugged terrain, of lesser length and volume than a creek; especially a stream that issues directly from the ground, as from a spring or seep, or that is produced by heavy rainfall or melting snow.&#10;(Source: BJGEO)
Chinese Term: 溪
Translation: 一条小溪或溪流，通常在崎岖地形迅速流动，长度和体积比河小；特别是直接从地面形成的流，由泉水或渗漏，或由暴雨或冰雪融化产生的。


Code: 1020
English Term: brushwood
Definition: Woody vegetation including shrubs and scrub trees of non-commercial height and form, often seen in the initial stages of succession following a disturbance. Brush often grows in very dense thickets that are impenetrable to wild animals and serve to suppress the growth of more desirable crop trees. However, brush can also serve an important function as desirable habitat for a range or bird, animal, and invertebrate species, and often provides a good source of browse and cover for larger wildlife. It adds structural diversity within the forest and is important in riparian zones. It is also termed scrub.&#10;(Source: DUNSTE)
Chinese Term: 矮灌木丛
Translation: 木本植被，包括非商业用的高度和形式的灌木丛和树木，多见于被干扰之后的初始阶段。灌木丛通常生长在茂密的树丛里，野生动物很难将其摧折，并且抑制其他树木生长。然而，灌木丛有一个重要的用途就是作为鸟类、动物和无脊椎动物物种的理想栖息地，而且经常可以给动物们作为草食，并且可以覆盖较大的野生动物。它增加了在森林结构的多样性，在沿岸地很重要。它也被称为矮树丛。


Code: 1023
English Term: bryophyte
Definition: Any plant of the division Bryophyta, having stems and leaves but lacking true vascular tissue and roots and reproducing by spores: includes the mosses and liverworts.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term: 苔藓类植物
Translation: 任何苔藓植物的分支，有茎、叶，但缺乏真正的维管束组织和根，孢子繁殖：包括苔藓和苔类。


Code: 1024
English Term: bubble policy (emissions trading)
Definition: EPA policy that allows a plant complex with several facilities to decrease pollution from some facilities while increasing it from others, so long as total results are equal to or better than previous limits. Facilities where this is done are treated as if they exist in a bubble in which total emissions are averaged out.&#10;(Source: EPAGLO)
Chinese Term: 泡泡政策（排放贸易）
Translation: 环保局的政策是，允许设施复杂的工厂，在增加其它设施污染的同时，减少一部分设施的污染，只要总结果等于或优于以前的限制。像这样处理过的设施，就好像它们存在于一个总排放量被平均的气泡中。


Code: 1025
English Term: budget
Definition: A balance sheet or statement of estimated receipts and expenditures. A plan for the coordination of resource and expenditures. The amount of money that is available for, required for, or assigned to a particular purpose.&#10;(Source: WESTS)
Chinese Term: 预算
Translation: 记录预计收入和支出的负债表或声明。协调资源和支出的计划。为了一个特定目的，可用的，需要的或者被分配的开支。




Code: 13137
English Term: budget policy
Definition: The programmatic use of a government's spending and revenue-generating activities to influence the economy and achieve specific objectives.&#10;(Source: MGHME)
Chinese Term: 预算政策
Translation: 影响经济和实现具体目标的，政府的支出和产生收入活动的程序化使用。


Code: 1028
English Term: bug
Definition: Any of the suborder Heteroctera, having piercing and sucking mouthparts, specialized as a beak.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term: 臭虫
Translation: 任何亚异角类动物，有刺吸式的口器——专门的喙。



Code: 1029
English Term: building
Definition: Something built with a roof and walls, such as a house or factory.&#10;(Source: CED)
Chinese Term: 建筑物
Translation: 有屋顶和墙壁的东西，如工厂的房子。



Code: 1031
English Term: building area
Definition: Land and other places on, under, in or through which the temporary and permanent works are to be executed and any other lands or places needed for the purposes of construction.&#10;(Source: ECHO1)
Chinese Term: 建筑区
Translation: 正在实施的临时和永久的建筑工作的土地或者其他地方，以及其他用于建筑目的的任何土地或地方。


Code: 1033
English Term: building component
Definition: A building element which uses industrial products that are manufactured as independent until capable of being joined with other elements.&#10;(Source: HARRIS)
Chinese Term: 建筑组件
Translation: 使用工业产品的建筑元素。这些建筑元素在和其他元素混合之前都是独立的。



Code: 11355
English Term: building destruction
Definition: The tearing down of buildings by mechanical means.&#10;(Source: MGHa)
Chinese Term: 建筑破坏
Translation: 通过机械手段对建筑物的拆除。



Code: 1039
English Term: building industry
Definition: The art and technique of building houses.&#10;(Source: ZINZAN)
Chinese Term: 建筑业
Translation: 建筑房屋的艺术和技术。


Code: 1041
English Term: building land
Definition: Area of land suitable for building on.&#10;(Source: PHC)
Chinese Term: 建筑土地
Translation: 适合建筑大楼的土地。



Code: 1042
English Term: building material
Definition: Any material used in construction, such as steel, concrete, brick, masonry, glass, wood, etc.&#10;(Source: HARRIS)
Chinese Term: 建筑材料
Translation: 任何用于建设的材料，例如钢铁、混凝土、砖、砌石、玻璃、木材等。

Code: 11375
English Term: building restoration
Definition: The accurate reestablishment of the form and details of a building, its artifacts, and the site on which it is located, usually as it appeared at a particular time.&#10;(Source: HARRIS)
Chinese Term: 建筑修复
Translation: 对建设的形式和细节的精确重建，涉及到构件，建筑工地，通常出现在一个特定的时间。



Code: 13232
English Term: building service
Definition: The aggregation of services, including construction, development, maintenance and leasing, performed for human-occupied properties, such as office buildings and apartment houses.&#10;(Source: PBS)
Chinese Term: 建筑服务
Translation: 包括建造、发展、维护和租赁，为人类占有属性的服务的聚合，如办公大楼和公寓房子。
